webp

Class WebpParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractImageParser
      • webp.WebpParser

  • public class WebpParser
extends AbstractImageParser
    This program aims to read WebP image files and retrieve data structured in a series of RIFF-based chunks. For metadata access, only the EXIF chunk, if present, will be processed. At this stage, XMP metadata is considered for inclusion in this class on a later date.

    WebP Data Stream

    The WebP file format is built on the RIFF container, beginning with a fixed signature: 

     RIFF + FileSize (4 bytes) + WEBP

    This is followed by a sequence of chunks. Each chunk includes:

    • 4 bytes: Chunk FourCC (ASCII, for example: VP8 , VP8X, EXIF)
    • 4 bytes: Chunk payload size (unsigned, little-endian)
    • Payload: Variable-length data
    • Padding: If size is odd, 1 padding byte follows (not counted in the size field)

    There are both mandatory and optional chunk types.

    Core Chunk Types

    • VP8 – Lossy bitstream (standard)
    • VP8L – Lossless bitstream
    • VP8X – Extended format chunk (required for metadata and animation)

    Optional Chunk Types

    • EXIF – Embedded EXIF metadata
    • ICCP – Embedded ICC color profile
    • XMP – XMP metadata
    • ANIM / ANMF – Animation control and frames

    Chunk Processing

    • Only chunks specified in the requiredChunks list are read
    • An empty requiredChunks list disables chunk extraction
    • A null list results in all chunks being extracted

    When the EXIF chunk is found, its payload is parsed as TIFF/EXIF-formatted metadata. This is commonly used to extract orientation, date, and camera information.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    WebP RIFF Container Specification

    • Method Detail

      • readMetadata

        public boolean readMetadata()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the WebP image file to extract all supported raw metadata segments.

        This implementation specifically looks for EXIF and XMP chunks. Because some encoders incorrectly wrap the EXIF payload in a JPEG-style preamble (the "Exif\0\0" marker), this method performs a stripping operation to ensure the underlying TIFF parser receives a valid byte stream.

        Specified by:
        readMetadata in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        true if at least one metadata segment (EXIF or XMP) was successfully parsed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a low-level I/O error occurs during stream reading

      • getMetadata

        public Metadata<DirectoryIFD> getMetadata()
        Retrieves the extracted metadata from the WebP image file, or a fallback if unavailable.
        Specified by:
        getMetadata in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a Metadata object

        public DigitalSignature getImageFormat()

      • formatDiagnosticString

        public java.lang.String formatDiagnosticString()
        Generates a human-readable diagnostic string containing metadata details.

        Currently this includes EXIF directory types, entry tags, field types, counts, and values.

        Overrides:
        formatDiagnosticString in class AbstractImageParser
        Returns:
        a formatted string suitable for diagnostics, logging, or inspection
